intro: Oxydectes villosa, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with silvery, hairy foliage that helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring or early summer. Its fibrous roots allow it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Oxydectes villosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
